summary: This bill, the Systemic Risk Authority Transparency Act, amends the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to increase transparency surrounding the use of systemic risk authority when winding up failed insured depository institutions. It mandates the Government Accountability Office (GAO) and the appropriate federal banking agency to produce reports for Congress detailing the basis for determinations, actions taken, potential effects, any mismanagement, and supervisory shortcomings. The reports aim to increase accountability and provide insights into the failures of financial institutions.
